title: AI Engineer (Agentic Systems & Full Stack)AI Engineer (Agentic Systems & Full Stack)
description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  About Cerina HealthCerina Health is a digital mental health company revolutionizing how mental healthcare is designed and delivered. We are moving beyond simple chatbots to build a proprietary Agentic AI Platform.Our mission is to solve the global mental health access crisis by building AI that is fundamentally safe. We use multi-agent architectures to design, simulate, and validate therapeutic protocols under strict clinical governance. We are combining the speed of Generative AI with the safety rigor of medical devices.We are a small, expert team working directly with leading clinical academics and experienced founders in a flat, high-trust environment.The RoleWe are looking for a high-velocity AI Engineer who lives at the intersection of modern full stack software development and Agentic AI.In this role, you will be instrumental in engineering the orchestration layer that manages multiple AI agents (Designers, Critics, Safety Supervisors) and building the interfaces that allow clinicians to interact with them. You will work on "Safety-by-Design" Agentic AI‚Äîone of the most critical and unsolved challenges in the industry.We value engineers who are highly adaptable, fast learners, and who embrace AI-assisted development tools (like Cursor, Claude Code etc.) to amplify their output and solve complex problems at speed.Key Responsibilities      Agentic Orchestration: Design and implement complex, stateful multi-agent workflows using LangGraph and LangChain. Build the logic for agents that propose content, check it against safety rules, and refine it autonomously.Frontend Development: Build sophisticated, responsive applications that visualise agentic workflows, allowing human experts to review, edit, and approve AI-generated clinical protocols.Safety Implementation: Implement "Supervisory Agents" that strictly enforce clinical boundaries to ensure safety and clinical fidelity.System Optimization: Work on optimizing the latency of agentic loops to enable real-time stress testing and simulation of therapeutic conversations.Rapid Prototyping: Use AI-assisted coding tools to rapidly prototype, debug, and iterate on new features.
Requirements1) Technical Skills:      Frontend Capable: Proficiency in TypeScript and modern UI development. While React & React Native is our preferred stack, we are open to engineers strong in other frameworks (Vue, Svelte) or those willing to learn React & React Native quickly. You must be able to build functional UIs to visualize agent workflows.AI Frameworks: Deep hands-on experience with Python, LangChain, and critically, LangGraph. You understand stateful, cyclic agentic graphs (beyond simple RAG chains).Architecture: Solid understanding of event-driven architectures, state machines, and asynchronous processing.
2) Soft Skills & Attributes:      AI-Augmented Workflow: You are proficient in using AI coding assistants (e.g., Cursor, Claude Code, GitHub Copilot) to accelerate development and explore new libraries.Fast Learner: You have a track record of rapidly picking up new tools and frameworks as they emerge. You thrive on "figuring it out."Problem Solver: You approach complex technical challenges with creativity and autonomy.
3) Nice to Have:      Experience in Digital Health, MedTech, or highly regulated industries.Familiarity with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, etc.).Experience with cloud infrastructure (GCP/AWS) and serverless deployment.
Why Join Us?      Work on the Frontier: Build cutting-edge Agentic AI systems that push the boundaries of what is possible in healthcare.Real Impact: Your code will directly contribute to making mental healthcare safer and more accessible for thousands of people.Remote & Flexible: We care about output and problem-solving, not hours in a chair.
Our Recruitment ProcessWe do not believe in broken recruitment practices like whiteboard coding or algorithmic quizzes. We believe the only way to evaluate an engineer is to see them build.      Application: You submit the form below.The Protocol Sprint: If shortlisted, you will receive a 72-hour architectural challenge (designed to be completed over a weekend). You will build a complex Agentic System using the AI tools of your choice.The Review: We review your code and Loom video.Final Interview: We discuss your architecture and make an offer.
How to ApplyTo apply, please complete the form below:- https://forms.gle/Jw37vA1fB3KjFuAw9

Kubernetes)Hardware enablement, GPUs, SmartNICs, storage, and sensorsGraphics, audio, multimedia stacksNetworking protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP/REST)IoT and embedded systems, firmware, bootloaders, and operating systemsPerformance optimization and toolchain maintenanceBenefits:Competitive, globally benchmarked compensation, reviewed annually.Remote-first work environment with twice-yearly in-person Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or additional assessments) are then made by their internal hiring team.Thank you for your interest!We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title:
Junior Ubuntu Software Engineer 
    
    

Junior Ubuntu Software Engineer with verification
description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.The company is founder led, profitable and growing.We are hiring junior engineers to work across the breadth of our Ubuntu Engineering organisation - engineers who care deeply for quality, performance and resilience in software, engineers who are just as comfortable designing and engineering new software as they are packaging, integrating, testing and shipping the incredible catalog of open source software provided by the Ubuntu repositories.Our engineers integrate the freshest open source software, provide robust upgrade paths and engineer the future of Ubuntu. Ubuntu is not just the world‚Äôs most deployed open source operating system, it's a platform that enables innovation for millions of users across the globe. Our community represents the full breadth of the developer experience; from students, hobbyists and freelancers to high performance engineering and creative teams in corporate and academic environments.The four key teams that ship Ubuntu are      Foundations: maintaining foundational software: architectures, package managers, compilers, toolchains, bootloaders, filesystems and core utilitiesServer: leading the design, evolution and future of our Ubuntu Server distributionDesktop: driving Ubuntu Desktop, our future immutable desktop: Ubuntu Core Desktop, WSL, gaming technology, and a suite of modern applications for the desktop crafted with FlutterDebcrafters: a new team responsible for the forward movement, maintenance and overall health of the Ubuntu archive: one of the most abundant repositories of open source software available today
Bring your existing expertise and learn new skills by working on one of the most prolific pieces of open source software. As an engineer working on Ubuntu you could work on any or all of the following categories:      Development: design, build and ship new foundational systems software and applications in Rust, Go, Flutter, and PythonArchitecture: engineer the integration of open source from boot firmware to cloud applications deploymentPackaging: a combination of Debian and Snap packaging to ship software in the distributionAutomation: build and maintain the machinery responsible for building, testing and shipping UbuntuDistro Engineering: the maintenance and evolution of a Linux distribution and its repositories
If you have skills in those areas, or you have other skills you believe could contribute to Ubuntu, and you're keen to get started building your career in open source, then this is the role for you. Our junior career path caters for both new graduates and early careers engineers.At Canonical, you will have the opportunity to engage with and contribute to the broader open source community. We're looking for individuals who can help build a thriving community and contribute with enthusiasm and precision to a broad range of technologies.Location: We have remote roles open in every time zone.The role entailsBased on the first round of interviews, we identify specific teams where you might be an excellent fit and conduct second-round interviews with those teams. Our engineers are:      Designing, building and shipping software in Rust, Go, Python and C/C++Packaging, integrating, testing and uploading open source software to the Ubuntu repositoriesDebugging issues, then designing and delivering robust solutionsAuthoring and improving technical and community documentationContributing to upstream and neighboring open source projectsCollaborating as part of a globally distributed teamContinuously learning and progressing their technical and professional skills
What We Are Looking For In You      An exceptional academic track record from both high school and universityUndergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative pathDrive and a track record of going above and beyond expectationsA passion for open source softwareExperience with Rust, Go, Python, Flutter or C/C++Professional written and spoken EnglishExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each
Nice-to-have Skills      Familiarity with Linux distributionsFamiliarity with system debugging tools and techniquesFamiliarity with automation tooling and CI/CD systemsExperience contributing to open source projects
What We Offer YouWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.      Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in personPersonal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per yearAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveMaternity and paternity leaveTeam Member Assistance Program & Wellness PlatformOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleaguesPriority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Familiarity with ML Model Deployment as REST APIs.

Familiarity with front-end JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js. Depending on the projects, you may be responsible for working within these frameworks Atleast 6+ years experience in AI ML concepts, Python (preferred), prefer knowledge in deep learning frameworks like PyTorch and TensorFlow Domain knowledge of Manufacturing/ process Industries, Physics and first principle based analysis Analytical thinking for translating data into meaningful insight and could be consumed by ML Model for Training and Prediction. You‚Äôll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.You‚Äôll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  We are hiring multiple Full Stack Developers to join global engineering teams building high-quality, scalable, cloud-native applications. These long-term, fully remote freelance roles are ideal for engineers who can own end-to-end development ‚Äî from frontend UI to backend services, APIs, databases, and cloud infrastructure.Engagement Details      Type: Independent Freelance ConsultantLocation: 100% RemoteDuration: 6‚Äì12 month contract (extendable to multi-year engagements)Start Date: Immediate or within the next few weeksClients: Global product companies, SaaS teams, and enterprise engineering groups
What You‚Äôll Work OnYou will own full-feature development across the stack, typically using JavaScript/TypeScript frameworks (React, Angular, Vue) on the frontend and Node.js, Python (Django/FastAPI), or Java (Spring Boot) on the backend.Your work will include:      Building responsive, high-quality frontend components in React, Angular, or Vue.Developing backend services and microservices using Node.js, Java, or Python.Designing and integrating REST and GraphQL APIs.Working with databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, or Redis, including performance optimization.Implementing authentication, role-based access, and common security patterns.Ensuring high code quality across frontend, backend, and cloud integrations.Collaborating with DevOps teams on CI/CD pipelines, cloud deployments, and container-based workflows.Participating in sprints, code reviews, and architecture discussions.Contributing to performance improvements across UI rendering, API latency, and overall system scalability.
Whether you‚Äôre comfortable with MERN, MEAN, Java + React, Python + React, or other modern full stack combinations ‚Äî you‚Äôll be able to leverage your expertise across real, complex global engineering projects.Minimum Qualifications      Minimum 2 years of hands-on full stack development experience.Strong skills in JavaScript/TypeScript plus one core backend language (Node.js, Python, or Java).Hands-on experience with at least one major frontend framework: React, Angular, or Vue.Solid understanding of relational and/or NoSQL databases.Experience building and consuming APIs (REST or GraphQL).Comfortable with Git, versioning, and modern development workflows.Ability to work independently in a distributed, remote environment.
Preferred Skills      Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).Understanding of microservices architecture and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).Experience with queues or event-driven systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, Pub/Sub).Familiarity with SSR/SSG tools (Next.js or similar).Understanding of system design and scaling fundamentals.Experience working in Agile/Scrum teams with cross-functional collaboration.
Why Join This Opportunity      Work on modern, global engineering projects with real complexity.Multiple openings allow for fast-track onboarding.100% remote with flexible hours.Long-term freelance opportunities with strong renewal potential.Exposure to modern full stack + cloud-native engineering practices.

About the job
            

            
                
                  At PwC, our people in software and product innovation focus on developing cutting-edge software solutions and driving product innovation to meet the evolving needs of clients. These individuals combine technical experience with creative thinking to deliver innovative software products and solutions. Those in software engineering at PwC will focus on developing innovative software solutions to drive digital transformation and enhance business performance. In this field, you will use your knowledge to design, code, and test cutting-edge applications that revolutionise industries and deliver exceptional user experiences.Driven by curiosity, you are a reliable, contributing member of a team. In our fast-paced environment, you are expected to adapt to working with a variety of clients and team members, each presenting varying challenges and scope. Every experience is an opportunity to learn and grow. You are expected to take ownership and consistently deliver quality work that drives value for our clients and success as a team. About the job
            

            
                
                  Reports to: Engineering LeadType: Full-TimeAbout The CompanyWe build human-guided intelligence (HGI) for real-time operations: intelligent agents embedded in dashboards and conversational UIs that are responsive, geospatially aware, and integrated with live sensor data. Agents assist with forecasting, alarm analysis, knowledge lookup, and more‚Äîso operators can ask natural-language questions and see the system zoom, highlight, and respond in context. The platform is modular and extensible for new agent types and data sources.About The RoleWe‚Äôre seeking a Frontend Developer to craft data-rich interfaces and visual tools that power our intelligent operations platform. You‚Äôll build dynamic dashboards, geospatial visualizations, and AI-augmented UIs that enable operators to interact naturally with real-time data. This is a key opportunity to shape how humans collaborate with AI in high-impact, time-sensitive environments.Key Responsibilities      Data Visualization & Dashboards: Build and scale interactive dashboards for live time-series, alarms, and forecasts using frameworks like D3.js and Recharts. Workflow Tools: Design and build GUI-based tools for configuring data pipelines (e.g., ‚ÄúConnect source ‚Üí Trigger forecasting agent ‚Üí Load to DB‚Äù). Collaboration: Work closely with backend and AI teams to ensure smooth data integration, performance optimization, and real-time responsiveness. 
Tech Stack      Core: React / Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS Visualization: D3.js, Recharts, Mapbox Integration: AWS Amplify, REST APIs, JSON-based agent responses 
What You Bring      Proven experience developing responsive, real-time dashboards and visualization interfaces. Fluency in React / Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind, and front-end testing frameworks. Strong understanding of data-driven UIs, event streams, and state management. Familiarity with auth flows (OAuth2/JWT) and frontend security best practices. Excellent collaboration skills using GitHub workflows, CI/CD pipelines, and code reviews.

In India, we're building a platform for innovative delivery and engagement that will strengthen our position as an industry leader. What We Offer       Performance-related pay Access to thousands of learning programs so you can level-up Global presence across 22 countries; opportunities to work where we do business. Up to 26 weeks maternity leave provided to the birth mother with benefits for all child births Up to 16 weeks paid paternity leave provided to the non-birthing partners Employees are entitled to 21 paid annual leaves per calendar year Eligible employees are entitled to 12 days of paid sick / casual leave per calendar year Relocation support options across India, from junior to senior positions within the company Receive insurance benefits such as medical, accidental and life insurances

Design and implement responsive user interfaces using modern front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and front-end frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js). Experience in Java 17+/Kotlin/Spring Boot, and ReactJS/JavaScript(ES6)/Angular Good experience in developing and designing microservices, Restful webservices and exposing APIs on API Gateway (eg: APIGEE) Solid knowledge of database technologies like, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB Knowledge of Java Testing frameworks like Junit 4/5, Mockito, WireMock Knowledge of React Testing frameworks like React Testing Library (RTL), Jest Proficiency in front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, SASS, Webpack Experience meeting WCAG Accessibility (A) standards. AWS/PCF or any Cloud Experience is must. Agile Scrum experience.  Desirable Skills: Strong understanding or experience with UX and/or Visual Design specialties. Typescript, Micro-frontends Knowledge of jvm and performance tuning of application Experience writing developer centric documentation Experience with Jira and Confluence or similar tools. title: Software Developer ‚Äì Full-Stack (SDE I / Early SDE II)Software Developer ‚Äì Full-Stack (SDE I / Early SDE II)
description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Software Developer ‚Äì Full-Stack (SDE I / Early SDE II)OverviewWiseshift is building a next-generation B2B commerce and inventory automation platform for FMCG businesses - bridging physical supply chains with digital intelligence.We‚Äôre seeking a Full-Stack Developer on WiseShift‚Äôs platform. This role is ideal for someone who loves building features end-to-end (API + UI), learns fast, and is excited to accelerate their growth and delivery. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with a Product architect / Technical lead and a Senior software engineer.Interested candidates can email their resumes to hr@wiseshiftenterprises.com or apply via LinkedIn.Role Type      Location: Bengaluru, KarnatakaDuration: Full-timeNotice Period: Immediate joiners preferred.Hybrid: 3 to 4 days on-site at our Bangalore office and 1 to 2 days remote (work from home).
We follow a flexible hybrid schedule focused on outcomes, not hours. During major releases or critical phases, team members may need to collaborate beyond standard workdays to ensure timely delivery and quality - like any fast-moving startup, we value ownership and adaptability.Key Responsibilities      Implement frontend modules in Next.js (React 19) and React Native for mobile.Build and integrate with backend REST APIs using Axios/Fetch.Develop CRUD features for Inventory, Orders, and Reports.Write SQL queries and maintain Sequelize models under guidance.Generate and test PDF/Excel reports using libraries (Excel.js, PDFKit).Collaborate asynchronously using pull requests and documented discussions.Assist in refactoring, linting, and ensuring consistent code quality.Participate in testing and bug triage with QA / consultant.Opportunity to grow into module ownership roles as platform scales.
Tech Stack      Frontend: Next.js 15, React 19, Tailwind CSSMobile: React Native, Redux Toolkit / Redux SagaBackend: Node.js (Express), Sequelize ORMDatabase: PostgreSQLCollaboration: GitHub, Notion, Slack, Zoom/TeamsPlus: Flexibility to experiment with emerging tools and frameworks as the platform evolves.
Qualifications      1.5 - 3 years of professional, production-level experience in full-stack or frontend development (internship-only experience will not qualify).Good command of JavaScript / TypeScript and React / Next.js.Familiarity with Node.js and SQL fundamentals.Exposure to REST API integration and authentication flows.Excellent communication and self-organization skills.Ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment with shifting priorities and tight deadlines.Comfortable taking ownership of tasks while collaborating asynchronously across teams.Eagerness to learn new-generation technologies and contribute to real product decisions.Openness to feedback, documentation, and continuous improvement.As an early engineer at Wiseshift, you‚Äôll shape the platform, take ownership of high-impact initiatives, and build a strong foundation for your career growth. With direct mentorship from experienced professionals, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow into lead, specialist, or technical leadership roles as we scale.Competitive compensation tied to performance and contribution.
Note: This is not an internship or entry-level role. We‚Äôre looking for engineers with prior hands-on, professional experience building and shipping real-world software.Nice-to-Have      React Native experience (Expo / Android).Experience with Tailwind CSS and responsive design.Interest in backend logic or data modeling.Exposure to ERPs or inventory management systems, especially in FMCG or retail domains.Understanding of supply chain and accounting workflows Familiarity with EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) standards for B2B data exchange.

title:
Senior Analyst, java full stack development and maintenance 
    
    

Senior Analyst, java full stack development and maintenance with verification
description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  What Application Development & Maintenance Contributes To Cardinal HealthInformation Technology oversees the effective development, delivery, and operation of computing and information services. This function anticipates, plans, and delivers Information Technology solutions and strategies that enable operations and drive business value.Application Development & Maintenance performs configuration or coding to develop, enhance and sustain the organization's software systems in a cross-functional team environment through adherence to established design control processes and good engineering practices. This job family programs and configures end user applications, systems, databases and websites to achieve the organization's internal needs and externally-facing business needs. Application Development & Maintenance partners with business leaders, investigates user needs and conducts regular assessments, maintenance and enhancements of existing applications.      Responsibilities:      Applies working knowledge in the application of concepts, principles and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks Works on projects of moderate scope and complexity Identifies possible solutions to a variety of technical problems and takes action to resolve Apply judgment within defined parameters Receives general guidance and may receive more detailed instruction on new projects Work reviewed for sound reasoning and accuracy 

Qualifications      3-5 years of experience in Java, web and micro services development. Bachelor's degree in computer science field, or equivalent work experience. 
Mandatory Skills      Proven work experience as a Software Engineer or Software Developer Experience in hypercare/production support and handling production incidents. Experience in designing interactive applications Ability to develop software in Java Spring boot programming languages with SQL & NO SQL DB Experience developing web applications using Angular Framework, JavaScript, and CSS Experience with test-driven development Proficiency in software engineering tools Ability to document requirements and specifications 
Desired Skills      Event driven Architecture, GCP and cloud knowledge adding an advantage. 
What is expected of you and others at this level (Do Not Modify/Can be removed completely if not required)      Proven work experience as a Software Engineer or Software Developer Willing to work in rotational shifts and on call support for the weekends (rotation basis). Experience in designing interactive applications Ability to develop software in Java Spring boot programming languages with SQL & NO SQL DB Excellent knowledge of relational databases, SQL and ORM technologies (JPA2, Hibernate) Experience developing web applications using Angular Framework, JavaScript, and CSS Experience with test-driven development Proficiency in software engineering tools Ability to document requirements and specifications 
Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Sales Development Representative (Entry Level)Sales Development Representative (Entry Level)
description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  About GrowthBuddyWe help match the finest remote talent with businesses based in the UK and Europe. We do this by sourcing, training, and placing full-time remote candidates for Sales & Marketing roles in less than 3 weeks.The opportunityWe‚Äôre looking for a full-time Sales Development Representative to help us find and connect with potential clients worldwide. You‚Äôll run outreach campaigns on LinkedIn, email, and other channels, and turn conversations into real opportunities. You‚Äôll work closely with the founders to experiment, refine strategies, and play a key role in how GrowthBuddy grows its client base.Role type: Full-time, fully remote (10 am ‚Äì 7 pm IST)Salary range: 4 - 4.5 LPAWho you are      You‚Äôre a recent graduate looking to kickstart your career in business development and sales. You don‚Äôt need prior experience; what matters is that you‚Äôre curious, driven, and eager to learn by doing.You take ownership of your work and hold yourself accountable for results. You like figuring things out rather than waiting for instructions, and you care about seeing things through from first outreach to final follow-up.You‚Äôre comfortable with the repetitive nature of outbound work and can stay steady and consistent with your outreach every day.You‚Äôre hands-on, organised, and motivated, able to manage multiple moving parts while keeping an eye on the details. When something doesn‚Äôt go as planned, you can think creatively and adapt quickly.You communicate with confidence, enjoy connecting with people, and can craft thoughtful messages, whether it‚Äôs on LinkedIn, over email, or during a call.You value feedback, see it as part of learning, and consistently look for ways to improve and grow in a fast-paced, remote environment.
What the job involves      You‚Äôll take ownership of lead generation and outreach activities across LinkedIn, email, cold calling, and other channels, to set up qualified conversations that open real opportunities.You‚Äôll manage structured outreach campaigns, consistently hitting daily and weekly activity targets to keep our pipeline strong and moving forward.You‚Äôll dive into market research to identify the right decision-makers and tailor outreach to connect with prospects who matter most.You‚Äôll keep our CRM sharp and organised, maintaining up-to-date prospect information so nothing slips through the cracks.You‚Äôll get hands-on experience with modern sales prospecting tools like Attio and LinkedIn Sales Navigator and learn how to use them effectively to scale outreach.You‚Äôll collaborate closely with the co-founder and team to refine targeting, messaging, and outreach strategies, including but not limited to the areas mentioned above.
Our hiring process      Assessment ‚Äì to understand how you think, approach and solve problems.Discovery call ‚Äì to learn more about you, your goals, and expectations.Practical round ‚Äì a short task to assess your approach to outbound and lead generation.Final interview ‚Äì to evaluate your mindset, communication skills, and fit with our culture.
What we offer      Work directly with the founder and be part of a growing company.Remote-first role with flexibility and ownership.A fast-paced learning environment with room to grow into a larger role as the company scales.
